meta.title: Irregular at Magic High School AU — Kudou Kageaki (The Elder Kudou)
universes: The Irregular at Magic High School
meta.theme: Control vs Contamination, Family as obligation, Existential anomalies, Containment of self
meta.story_universe: The Irregular at Magic High School
themes: Existential anomalies in modern magic theory
The parallel burdens of the 'Irregular' and the 'Anomalous'
research_focus: JJK technique mechanics translated to information-dimension logic
First High School academic curriculum and CAD engineering
Student council and school committee politics
Tactical synergy between Decomposition/Regrowth and Shadow/Parasite manipulation
meta.power_limitations: Constant Psion/Pushion suppression required; high psychological strain from managing autonomous Pushion-entities; risk of shadow-sink if Psion reserves are depleted; creation of parasites causes permanent or temporary depletion of the user's own Information Body integrity.
meta.user_intent: The story begins at the start of the First High School enrollment arc, following Kudou Kageaki, the elder brother of Minoru Kudou and the designated heir of the Kudou family. He acts as a primary partner and ally alongside Tatsuya Shiba, forming a formidable duo that navigates the events of the series from the beginning. Kageaki's power is a dark existential anomaly: he creates Artificial Parasites from his own Psions, effectively fragmenting his own information-body to manifest entities and the Ten Shadows Technique. The narrative utilizes a 'Gradual Discovery' approach, where the full extent of his self-fragmentation and the true nature of his 'Shadows' are revealed slowly to both the characters and the reader. As a Course 1 'Bloom' with high social standing, he provides a political and tactical counterpoint to Tatsuya's 'Weed' status, while secretly operating as an Anomalous Strategic-Class asset in a state of constant self-containment.

status.mental_state: Hyper-disciplined and stoic; experiencing gradual ego-decay from fragmentation.
status.health: Peak physical condition; under constant spiritual strain due to self-fragmentation.

Shiba_Miyuki.dynamics: Professional respect. Miyuki recognizes Kageaki as someone Tatsuya respects, which grants him her cautious trust. Kageaki treats her with the etiquette expected of a Master Clan heir.

Kudou_Minoru.dynamics: Kageaki is extremely protective of Minoru, having accepted the burden of being the designated heir and experimental success to allow Minoru a semblance of a normal life. Kageaki serves as Minoru's containment officer during flares.

strategic_asset.reputation: An unlisted, anomalous threat capable of existential contamination.
strategic_asset.name: Shadow of the Ninth

canon_scene_examples.outcome: Megumi nearly crushed by mass; forces battle into water to ruin opponent's paper contracts.
canon_scene_examples.how_deployed: Megumi expands a sea of liquid shadow in a gym, dropping cars into his shadow to pin himself and his opponent. Demonstrated the physical weight burden of the technique.

canon_scene_examples.outcome: Mahoraga adapts to Unlimited Void before even being summoned.
canon_scene_examples.how_deployed: Sukuna places the Mahoraga wheel on Megumi's soul within the shadow. The fragmented soul bears the burden of adaptation to Gojo's 'Unlimited Void' while Sukuna fights.

canon_scene_examples.scene: The Fear of the Cursed Womb
canon_scene_examples.how_deployed: Megumi summons Nue to carry an ally and deliver electrical paralysis to a target. Shows the aerial utility of the technique.

signature_moves.description: Twin wolves for tracking/shredding. Totality inherits power upon death.
signature_moves.name: Divine Dogs: Totality

signature_moves.description: Aerial support bird with electrical vibration discharge.
signature_moves.name: Nue
Mahoraga
signature_moves.description: Ultimate adaptation engine. Analyzes and rewrites magic sequences.

signature_moves.name: Rabbit Escape
signature_moves.description: Swarm distraction using hundreds of rabbit clones. Overwhelms Elemental Sight.

mastery_progression: Level 4: Partial manifestation / Burden of Adaptation usage
sources.combat_style: Tactical / Adaptive / Hybrid. Kageaki uses shadows for inventory storage (weapons, CADs) and stealth, while deploying semi-autonomous 'Artificial Parasites' to flank or neutralize opponent magic. High synergy with physical combat.
weaknesses_and_counters: Permanent loss of Eidos mass if a shadow is destroyed.
Physical burden of stored mass (Shadow weight).
MCA Overheat from managing multiple autonomous fragments.
One-shot requirement to defeat Mahoraga before adaptation.

Shiba_Residence.name: Shiba Residence
Shiba_Residence.atmosphere: Quiet, minimalist, high security but domestic.
Shiba_Residence.description: The apartment where Tatsuya and Miyuki live alone while attending First High.

Practice_Hall_1.description: The main combat training facility for Course 1 students. Forbidden to Course 2 students.
Practice_Hall_1.name: Practice Hall 1

core_rules.description: Kageaki shears off chunks of his own Psion/Pushion reserves to create Independent Information Bodies (Artificial Parasites).
core_rules.name: Self-Fission / Fragmentation
Shadow as Gateway to Idea
core_rules.description: Kageaki uses shadows as 'areas of low photon density' to manifest his fragmented Eidos without a physical host.

limitations.reason: Summoned Shadows reduce maximum Psion capacity and processing speed. Loss of a shadow causes 'Information Shock' to the physical brain.

Kudou_Retsu.example_dialogue: 'Kageaki, you are the shadow that ensures the light of the Ten Master Clans continues to shine. Never forget your weight.'
Kudou_Retsu.verbal_tics: Occasional chuckles that don't reach his eyes. Hand-to-chin contemplation.
Kudou_Retsu.emotional_tells: The 'Elder's' warmth can vanish instantly into a cold, military-sharp command.
topics_to_discuss: The future of the Nine Schools Competition
Kudou_Retsu.speech_patterns: Grandfatherly but authoritative. Uses 'young man' or 'grandson.' Speaks with the weight of someone who survived the 'Nightmare of 2062.'
topics_to_avoid: The true cruelty of the Ninth Institute's past experiments

meta_knowledge_forbidden: Tatsuya Shiba is the Strategic-Class magician Maheshvara (Initially)
The true nature of Parasites as extra-dimensional entities (Initially)
The Yotsuba family's involvement in Tatsuya's mental remodeling
The full list of JJK shikigami (Characters must discover them as Kageaki 'tames' his fragments)

costs_paid.cost: Mental strain from maintaining Shadow containment during high-stress social interaction

near_misses.what_almost_happened: Almost revealed true nature to Tatsuya via Elemental Sight contact

events.universe: Wormverse (Mistake in prompt, correcting to Mahouka)
events.event: The Nightmare of 2062: Great Asian Alliance attacks Yotsuba family. Kudou Retsu participates in the rescue of Maya Yotsuba.

consequences: Introduction of hidden Strategic-Class magic in Japan
events.event: Okinawa Defense Battle: Tatsuya Shiba uses Material Burst for the first time.
Entrance Ceremony at First High School. Shiba siblings and Kudou Kageaki enroll.
consequences: Start of the First High School Enrollment Arc

events.event: The Hallway Incident: Tatsuya de-escalates a Bloom/Weed conflict without magic.
The Mock Duel: Tatsuya defeats Vice President Hattori, demonstrating non-systematic efficiency.
Blanche/Egalite Agitation: Anti-magic groups target First High students.
Scorched Halloween: Public use of Strategic-Class Magic.

canon_timeline.current_position: April 5, 2095 - Entrance Ceremony at First High School, The Hallway Incident

events.event: Entrance Ceremony at First High School

list.what_changed: Kudou Kageaki actively intervened/observed the Hallway Incident, alerting Tatsuya to his presence earlier than canon.
